A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Ok movie making but horrible HORRIBLE series destroying movie

--SPOILERS--

The Holdo Maneuver: If this is possible\, and previous Star Wars Movies show it's not\, but if it is possible then you'd expect every space battle to use it. There'd be ships that are nothing but a hunk of metal and a hyperdrive who's sole purpose is to hyperdrive ram other ships

Jedi Attacking from the Dead: Apparently all the dead Jedi can use the force from beyond the grave. So they the F haven't they been fighting with the rebellion the entire series?

Rose saving Finn was the most selfish move ever yet somehow we're supposed to feel good about it.

Rose and Finn's adventure ended up causing hundreds of deaths\, no one cares

Poe's mutiny basically ignored. Unbelievable

There's more nits but those 4 are enough and the top 2 are effectively the end of Star Wars. We'd now expect every battle to have hyperspace rammers and every battle to be full of dead Jedi calling down lighting bolts from heaven.  Ugh!
